Key Match Events: South Africa choked in front of a spirited Netherlands and crashed out of the T20 World Cup after suffering a 13-run defeat in Adelaide on Sunday.
Colin Ackermann's late-hitting took Netherlands to 158/4 after put into bat.
Brandon Glover returned with the figures of 3/9 in his two overs as he bagged the crucial wickets of Rilee Rossouw (25) and David Miller (17).
Fred Klaassen joined the party as South Africa continued to lose wickets in regular intervals.
Pre-Game Insights: The Temba Bavuma-led side, who were one win away from securing a semi-final spot, threw away their chances.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's defeat means that India have qualified for the last four stage.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Either Pakistan or Bangladesh will join India as 2nd semi-finalist from Group 2
If the match gets washed out, then Pakistan will be through based on better net run rate.
Others: South Africa had a horrendous start as they lost their openers Quinton de Kock and Temba Bavuma in the powerplay overs.
Netherlands had a slow start, with openers Stephan Myburgh and Max O'Dowd adding 58 runs for the first wicket.
Keshav Maharaj then ended O'Dowd (29) struggle as South Africa reduced Netherlands to 97/2 in 12.4 overs.
Cooper played a knock of 35 off just 19 balls before Maharaj foxed him with the lack of pace.
